name: 4-(1-pyrrolidinyl)pyridine
Reason: 4-(1-pyrrolidinyl)pyridine has a melting point that can be predicted by considering the basic unit of pyridine, which has a melting point of 5.5°C. The pyrrolidinyl group can increase the melting point due to its ability to enhance π-π interactions and rigidity, estimated at around +20°C. The presence of a nitro group can also contribute to the melting point due to its ability to participate in hydrogen bonding and increase molecular weight, estimated at around +10°C. The methyl group can also contribute to the melting point due to its ability to participate in hydrogen bonding and increase molecular weight, estimated at around +5°C.
